intro: Angraecum dolichorhizum, commonly known as the long-rooted star orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue with intricate patterns. The plant has long, slender roots and is adapted to grow in rocky or dry environments. It produces a single, fragrant flower per inflorescence, which blooms at night, attracting specific pollinators. Angraecum dolichorhizum is a rare and endangered species, making it a subject of interest for conservation efforts.
